Method Detail

containsIgnoreCase

public static boolean containsIgnoreCase(java.lang.String text,
                                         java.lang.String s2)
Performs a case-insensitive java.lang.String.contains() operation.

Parameters:
text - main body of text to check.
s2 - we will try to check if s2 is contained in text.
Returns:
True if s2 was found, case-insensitive, in text.

arraysShareElement

public static boolean arraysShareElement(java.lang.String[] a1,
                                         java.lang.String[] a2)
Determines if two arrays of Strings share at least one element.

Parameters:
a1 - The first array
a2 - The second array
Returns:
True if the arrays share at least one element

listify

public static java.lang.String[] listify(java.lang.String s,
                                         java.lang.String prefix,
                                         java.lang.String... ignorelist)
Parses a String, assumed to be a list, into a String array. Each item in the list must be separated by a newline character. Space characters are ignored. The ignore list is case sensitive, and only checks if each String in the list starts with the specified text; this is useful for parsing out comments and/or unwanted crap.

Parameters:
s - The String to use (must be delimited by new line chars)
prefix - Adds a prefix to the beginning of each element. Specify "" for no prefix.
ignorelist - If an item in the list contains a String in this list, it won't be included in the final result. Whatever you do, don't put an empty string in here; you'll be sorry :3

getFileExt

public static java.lang.String getFileExt(java.lang.String fn)
Parses out the extension for a filename.

Parameters:
fn - The filename to parse (e.g. Example.jpg)
Returns:
The extension of the file, without the "." Returns null if this file has no extension.
